channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mattress and rubbish has been dumped, 29th October
item.description:
Mattress and rubbish has been dumped on pavement outside 20 Waverley Crescent, Plumstead, London SE18. Eyesore and is partly blocking the pavement. Think it was put there late on 28/10/25 or early morning 29/10/25. I didn't see it being dumped.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Waverley Crescent, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light 8 not working, 29th October
item.description:
Street light 8 on Mornington Street Bridge is not working and has not been working for many months. With night beginning earlier, this is unsafe for pedestrians and road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mornington Street, Chalk Farm, London

item.title: Fixed then un-fixed, 29th October
item.description:
This cover was fixed recently and the banging stopped but a few days later it was removed bringing it the original issue back again. Is there something more permanent?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 525, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Sidcup Hill, 29th October
item.description:
Flags are being hanged up aling Sidcp Hill by two groups of men with with ladders. They were making racist remarks to me and my son while we were having an evening walk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foots Cray High Street, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag put up outside my property., 29th October
item.description:
Three men appeared outside my property putting up a flag on the lamp post outside my house. I went outside to ask them to please not put it up outside my property. The three men proceeded to mock me and my partner and then told us a story about a funeral taking place tomorrow and that they would be back to take down the flags. Clearly, I don’t believe that and I am now left feeling unsafe and uncomfortable in my own house.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup Hill, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Worn out crossing, 29th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Barnehurst Road, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Still no can or plastic recycling, 29th October
item.description:
I have reported this in the past and was told there are no resources to replace the broken Can/plastic recycling bin .. This was months ago and I appreciate there may not be funding .. BUT as this site is on the recycling centre entrance … there are currently 10 Paper & Cardboard bins but Zero for Pladtic /Cans .. why not convert 2 into tins & plastics and empty twice a week rather than the current once a week .. especially as the recycling centre is closed till 2026 and the bins are overflowing most weeks and many customers not knowing what to do just dispose of the tins and plastic in the glass recycling effectively contaminating the recycling…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baths Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
